verbose_text: In contrast, administration of IL-8 (or the rat analogue CINC-1) in peripheral tissues or intrathecally causes an increase in pain sensitivity that can be reversed by beta-adrenergic receptor antagonists or guanethidine but not COX-2 inhibitors, which fits well with the inefficacy of COX-2 inhibitors in FM.
evidence: IL-8 (or the rat analogue CINC-1) in peripheral tissues or intrathecally causes an increase in pain sensitivity               that can be reversed by beta-adrenergic receptor antagonists               or guanethidine               but not COX-2 inhibitors
